snippet: The government sold a 13 percent stake to institutional investors overnight and will complete its exit by giving its remaining shares to employees of the postal service.
abstract: British government raises 591.1 million pounds, or $907 million, by selling most of its stake in Royal Mail, operator of Britain’s postal service; says it will give its remaining 1 percent stake to eligible Royal Mail employees, completing its exit from company.
lead_paragraph: The government sold a 13 percent stake to institutional investors overnight and will complete its exit by giving its remaining shares to employees of the postal service.

headline.main: Sale of Royal Mail Stake Nets $907 Million for British Government
headline.print_headline: Business Briefing; Britain Raises £591.1 Million With Royal Mail Stock Sale
